title: "prysmtcl testnet generate-genesis" command does not output genesis state in json format
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description I am setting up a devnet using geth and prysm beacon chain. I need to output the generated genesis state for the beacon chain to a JSON file to do some manipulation. The console logs say the command was completed successfully but an empty object is written to the JSON file. Using the `--output-ssz` flag outputs the state fine and it's able to run the network. Any help here would be appreciated. Thanks in advance. üôèüèº Command: `./prysmctl testnet generate-genesis --fork bellatrix --num-validators 8 --output-json ./test-genesis.json --chain-config-file=./consensus/config.yml --geth-genesis-json-in ./execution/genesis.json --geth-genesis-json-out ./execution/genesis.json` Output: ``` INFO[0000] Specified a chain config file: ./consensus/config.yml prefix=genesis INFO[0000] No genesis time specified, defaulting to now() prefix=genesis INFO[0000] setting fork geth times prefix=genesis shanghai=0xc000776a30 INFO[0000] Done writing genesis state to ./test-genesis.json prefix=genesis INFO[0000] Command completed prefix=genesis ``` ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Unknown ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction `./prysmctl testnet generate-genesis --num-validators 8 --output-json ./test-genesis.json` ## üî• Error N/A ## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
macOS Version 13.4
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
v4.0.6
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?** N/A
